member.name: T:PostSharp.CodeModel.SymbolSequencePoint
member.summary: Maps a point in IL instructions to location in source code.
member.remarks: This class implements the interface. This allows sorting sequence points according to their IL offsets and performing binary searches in sorted arrays.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.ImplementationBoundAttributeAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute meaning that custom attributes of a given type are bound to the implementation, not to the semantics.

remarks.para: This custom attribute influences whether instances of a given other custom attribute should be moved from the semantic to the implementation, when the semantic is detached from the implementation. This happens for instance when a property is generated from a field; the property become the semantic (and is made public) and the field the implementation (and is made private). Most custom attributes apply to semantics, so they are moved from the field to the property. If a custom attribute must not be moved, it should be marked with the custom attribute.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Extensibility.ImplementationBoundAttributeAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes the new .
member.param: Type of the custom attribute that should not be moved from implementation to semantic.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.ImplementationBoundAttributeAttribute.AttributeType
member.summary: Gets the type of the custom attribute that should not be moved from implementation to semantic

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.IRequirePostSharp
member.summary: When implemented on a custom attribute, means that the attribute requires a PostSharp task to be executed.
member.remarks: Custom attributes implementing this property are recognized by the AutoDetectTask task, which should be included in the project.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Extensibility.IRequirePostSharp.GetPostSharpRequirements
member.summary: Gets the requirements of the current custom attribute.
member.returns: The requirements of the current custom attribute.

member.summary: Represents the collection of tasks required by a custom attribute implementing .

member.summary: Gets the collection of required plug-ins.
member.remarks: This collection should contain the file name of plug-in configuration files without the .psplugin extension. Plug-in configuration files should be located in the search path.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.PostSharpRequirements.Tasks
member.summary: Gets the collection of tasks required by the current attribute.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.PostSharpRequirements.VariesWithInstance
member.summary: Determines whether custom attribute instances of the same type may have different requirements.
member.value: true if custom attribute instances of the same type may have different requirements, otherwise false.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that can be applied to multiple elements using wildcards.

remarks.para: Each class derived from should be decorated with an instance of .

Multicasting is performed by the MulticastAttributeTask, which should be included in the project. After multicasting, custom attribute instances are available on the CustomAttributeDictionaryTask class.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetElements
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of elements to which this custom attributes applies.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression specifying to which types this instance applies.
member.value: A wildcard or regular expression specifying to which types this instance applies, or null this instance applies either to all types. Wildcard expressions should start with the regex: prefix.
member.remarks: Ignored if the are only the module and/or the assembly.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetTypeAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibilities of types to which this attribute applies.
member.remarks: On type-level, the only meaningfull enumeration values are related to visibility.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression specifying to which members this instance applies.
member.value: A wildcard or regular expression specifying to which members this instance applies, or null this instance applies either to all members whose kind is given in . Wildcard expressions should start with the regex: prefix.

remarks.para: Ignored if the only are only types.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetAssemblies
member.summary: Gets or sets the assemblies to which the current attribute apply.
member.value: Wildcard or regular expression specifying to which assemblies this instance applies, or null if this instance applies only to elements of the current assembly. Wildcard expressions should start with the regex: prefix.
member.remarks: When this property is not specified or is null, the current attribute is multicasted only in the current assembly. Otherwise, it is multicasted also to external assemblies, i.e. to declarations that are referenced by the current assembly.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeTargetMemberAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibilities, scopes, virtualities, and implementation of members to which this attribute applies.

remarks.para: Ignored if the are only the module, the assembly, and/or types.

The enumeration is a multi-part flag: there is one part for visibility, one for scope, one for virtuality, and one for implementation. If you specify one part, it will override the values defined on the custom attribute definition. If you do not specify it, the values defined on the custom attribute definition will be inherited. Note that custom attributes may apply restrictions on these attributes. For instance, a custom attribute may not be valid on abstract methods. You are obviously not allowed to 'enlarge' the set of possible targets.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeExclude
member.summary: If true, indicates that this attribute removes all other instances of the same attribute type from the set of elements defined by the current instance.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the current attribute in case that multiple instances are defined on the same element (lower values are processed before).

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttribute.AttributeReplace
member.summary: Determines whether this attribute replaces other attributes found on the target declarations.
member.value: true if the current instance will replace previous ones, or false if it will be added to previous instances.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that determines the usage of a .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.#ctor(PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastTargets)
member.summary: Initializes a new .
member.param: Kinds of targets that instances of the related apply to.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.ValidOn
member.summary: Gets the kinds of targets that instances of the related apply to.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.AllowMultiple
member.summary: Determines wether many instances of the custom attribute are allowed on a single declaration.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.AllowExternalAssemblies
member.summary: Determines whether this attribute can be applied to declaration of external assemblies (i.e. to other assemblies than the one in which the custom attribute is instanciated).

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.PersistMetaData
member.summary: Determines whether the custom attribute should be persisted in metadata, so that it would be available for System.Reflection.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.TargetMemberAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the attributes of the members (fields or methods) to which the custom attribute can be applied.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.TargetTypeAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the attributes of the types to which the custom attribute can be applied. If the custom attribute relates to fields or methods, this property specifies which attributes of the declaring type are acceptable.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributeUsageAttribute.AutoReplace
member.summary: Specifies that new instance of custom attributes always replace inherited ones or ones with lower priority, even if their property is not set.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastTargets
member.summary: Kinds of targets to which multicast custom attributes () can apply.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: Property (but not methods inside the property).

member.summary: Event (but not methods inside the event).

member.summary: Any member (, , , , ).

member.name: T:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes
member.summary: Attributes of elements to which multicast custom attributes () apply.
member.remarks: When specifying attributes of target members or types, do not forget to provide all categories of flags, not only the category on which you want to put a restriction. If you want to limit, for instance, a custom attribute to be applied on public members, a good pratice is to set TargetMemberAttributes = MulticastAttributes.Public | ~MulticastAttributes.AnyVisibility, unless the parent is more restrictive, in which case you should specify attributes explicitely.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the set of target attributes is inherited from the parent custom attribute.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes.Private
member.summary: Private (visible inside the current type).

member.name: F:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes.Protected
member.summary: Protected (visible inside derived types).

member.name: F:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes.Internal
member.summary: Internal (visible inside the current assembly).

member.summary: Internal and protected (visible inside derived types that are defined in the current assembly).

member.name: F:PostSharp.Extensibility.MulticastAttributes.InternalOrProtected
member.summary: Internal or protected (visible inside all derived types and in the current assembly).

member.summary: Public (visible everywhere).

member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to an assembly, means that all assemblies that reference this assembly need to be post-compiled by PostSharp.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the custom attribute.
member.param: Name of the task that is required to be executed on linked assemblies.
Name of the plug-in that contains the task, or null if the declaring plugin was already loaded.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.ReferencingAssembliesRequirePostSharpAttribute.PlugIn
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the plug-in in which the task is located.
member.remarks: A file named after the value of the current property and having the extension .psplugin should exist in the search path.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Extensibility.ReferencingAssembliesRequirePostSharpAttribute.Task
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the task required by linked assemblies.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Post
member.summary: Provides some methods that are transformed during post-compilation.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Post.Cast``2(``0)
member.summary: At post-compile time, casts an instance of a type into another. A post-compile time error is reported if the source type cannot be assigned to the target type.
member.param: Instance to be casted.
member.remarks: The purpose of this method is to make a source code compilable even when an interface will be implemented at post-compile time. PostSharp ensures that is assignable from . If yes, the call to this method is simply suppressed. If types are not assignable, a build error is issued.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Post.GetValue``1(``0)
member.summary: When used to retrieve the value of a field, forces the compiler to retrieve a copy of the field value instead of an address to this field. This allows to call instance methods of value-type fields without loading the field address.
member.typeparam: Type of the value to retrieve (this type parameter can generally be omitted).
member.param: Value.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Post.IsTransformed
member.summary: Determines whether the calling program has been transformed by PostSharp.
member.value: true if the calling program has been transformed by PostSharp, otherwise false.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Reflection.CustomReflectionBinder
member.summary: Custom implementation of a reflection that select methods based on exact matches using the .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Reflection.CustomReflectionBinder.Instance
member.summary: Singleton instance.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Reflection.GenericArg
member.summary: Classes derived from represent unbound generic arguments. It is a 'trick' to create unbound generic instances, because C# and System.Reflection does not make it possible. Use the method to bind the unbound generic arguments to concrete types.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Reflection.GenericArg.Map(System.Type,System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Binds unbound generic arguments to concrete types.
member.param: A containing unbound generic arguments (derived from ).
Array of types to which the unbound generic type arguments should be bound.
Array of types to which the unbound generic method parameters should be bound.
member.returns: A where unbound generic arguments have been replaced by and .

member.summary: Comparer of reflection types () based on content, not reference. Supports the unbound generic parameters derived from the class.

member.summary: Gets an instance of that does not perform substitution of generic parameters.
